title: 1.1.2 Data Formats (JSON, XML, etc.)
body_html:
1.1.2 Data Formats (JSON, XML, etc.)

Overview

Data formats are standardized ways of encoding information for storage and transmission. Common data formats used in APIs and integrations include JSON, XML, CSV, and YAML.

Common Data Formats

  • JSON (JavaScript Object Notation): A lightweight data-interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate.
  • XML (Extensible Markup Language): A markup language designed for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.
  • CSV (Comma-Separated Values): A simple file format used to store tabular data, such as a spreadsheet or database.
  • YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language): A human-readable data serialization standard that can be used in conjunction with all programming languages and is often used for configuration files.

Comparison

Feature JSON XML CSV YAML
Readability High Medium Low High
Complexity Low High Low Medium
Use Cases Web APIs Documents, Data Interchange Tabular Data Configuration Files
